Description:
GRADUATE ENGINEER - GEOTECHNICALAssist in the design of geotechnical, geophysical and geo-environmental site investigations including recommendations for best intrusive techniques to be employed and specification of in-situ and laboratory testing.
Assist in procurement of site investigation contractors.
Supervise site investigation contractors, and have previous experience of undertaking site investigations and logging of soils and rocks.
Undertake terrain evaluation, geohazard identification and field mapping of rock slopes/outcrops
Undertake scheduling of geotechnical and geo-environmental testing and also interpretation of the test results.
Assist in the review of factual and interpretative geotechnical, geophysical and geo-environmental reports produced by others.
Assist in the production of geotechnical and geo-environmental factual and interpretative reports â€“ including the interpretation of geotechnical data.
Evaluate and interpret data using 2D/3D geological and geotechnical modelling.
Produce technical notes and geotechnical specifications.Skills
Skills:
Degree qualified within a geo-science, geology or geotechnical related field
Holding a driver's license.
Able to undertake project based travel and site work depending on business and client needs.
Knowledge and experience in the following areas (as many as possible):
Site investigation techniques with experience in supervising field investigation works.
Describing soil and rocks to international standards.
A good understanding of engineering geology, structural geology and geological mapping principles.
Experience with large data integration and development of geological models and engineering parameters.
An understanding of Geotechnical Interpretative Reports including recommendations for deep and shallow foundations and shoring works.
An understanding of foundations and shoring walls within soils and rocks would be advantageous.
Good working knowledge of software packages such as Holebase, Dips, and other Rocscience software or similar.
Knowledge of software packages such as WALLAP, Pdisp, Slope W or similar would be advantageous.
An understanding of various ground improvement techniques.
Experience of slope stability analyses using appropriate software with associated rock mass classifications, LE and FE modelling and kinematic analyses.
Understanding of geo-environmental assessments including Phase 1, 2 and 3.
Some construction experience in deep foundations, Bulk Earthworks, shoring and ground improvement etc.
Any skills with AutoCAD and Civil 3D software would be advantageous.
